meanings.definition: Put an end to (a rebellion or other disorder), typically by the use of force.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers worked hard to quell the riot in the city.
meanings.sent2: The police were able to quell the protest before it turned violent.
meanings.sent3: The mayor's speech managed to quell the boredom of the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence seemed to quell the storm of emotions in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's firm tone was enough to quell any further disruptions in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Suppress (a feeling, especially an unpleasant one).
meanings.sent1: She tried to quell her anxiety by taking deep breaths.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't quell his excitement when he heard the good news.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie helped quell her sadness for a while.
meanings.sent4: The warm tea seemed to quell her worries for the night.
meanings.sent5: The music had a calming effect that helped quell his nerves before the performance.
